items.title: 정치권 “홈플러스 사태, 경영 실패 아닌 사기적 기획…구속 수사 불가피”
items.summary: ‘홈플러스 사태’와 관련해 구속영장이 청구된 김병주 MBK파트너스 회장과 김광일 부회장 등 주요 경영진에 대한 구속 수사를 촉구하는 목소리가 정치권을 중심으로 확산되고 있다. 야권은 이번 사태를 단순한 경영상 실패가 아닌, 치밀하게 기획된 사기적 범죄로 규정하며 사법부의 엄정한 판단을 요구하고 있다.   더불어민주당 민병덕 의원과 조국혁신당 신장식 의원, 사회민주당 한창민 의원은 12일 국회에서 기자회견을 열고 “김광일 부회장 겸 홈플러스 대표이사 등 경영진 4명에 대한 구속 수사가 필요하다”고 주장했다. 이들은 검찰이 특정경제범죄...

items.title: '부정청약' 41건엔 없었는데…주택법 위반 의혹
items.summary:
<앵커>

이혜훈 장관 후보자 측이 2년 전 청약으로 분양받은 서울 서초구 아파트와 관련해, 당시 국토부는 실태 조사를 통해 41건의 부정 청약을 찾아냈습니다. 하지만, 이 후보자 측은 이때 적발되지 않았습니다. 야당에서는 이 후보자 측이 '위장 미혼'으로 주택법 등을 어겼다며 수사를 촉구했습니다.

보도에 박찬범 기자입니다.

<기자>

이혜훈 기획예산처 장관 후보자 가족이 서울 서초구의 고가 아파트 청약에 당첨된 시점은 지난 2024년 8월입니다.

당시 국토교통부는 청약 실태를 점검했는데, 해당 아파트에서만 부정청약을 41건이...

items.title: 코인원, 신임 최고운영책임자에 …김천석 前 의식주컴퍼니 부사장
items.summary: 코인원이 전 의식주컴퍼니 부사장 출신인 김천석(사진) 신임 최고운영책임자(COO)를 영입했다고 12일 밝혔다.  김 COO는 서울대 경제학부 졸업 후 SK텔레콤 마케팅 매니저로 커리어를 시작해 SK플래닛, 구글, 크리테오 등 글로벌 빅테크 기업에 몸담았다.  2021년부터는 비대면 모바일 세탁 서비스 ‘런드리고’의 운영사 의식주컴퍼니의 COO, 최고비즈니스책임자·부사장(CBO)을 역임했다.  김 COO는 향후 코인원의 서비스 운영, 마케팅 전략, 조직문화 등 기업 운영 전반에 걸친 업무를 총괄할 예정이다.  올해 업계를 둘러싼 제도...

items.title: “APEC 효과”... 경주 관광객 5000만 돌파
items.summary: 천년고도(千年古都) 경주의 관광객이 처음으로 5000만명을 돌파했다.12일 경주시는 한국관광데이터랩 통계를 인용해 지난 한 해 경주를 찾은 외지인 관광객 수가 5020만명을 기록했다고 밝혔다. 2023년의 4709만명보다 311만명(6.6%) 이상 증가했다. 외국인 관광객 수도 138만명으로 직전년도(118만명)보다 17% 늘었다.지역 내 주요 관광지에도 발길이 늘었다. 번화가인 황리단길과 대릉원 일대에는 872만명이, 동궁과 월지에는 162만명이 방문했다. 1년 사이 관광객이 각각 95만명, 4만명 더 증가했다.경주시는 관광객이 ...

items.title: ‘尹 정부 실세’ 전직 행정관 음주운전 불구속 기소
items.summary: 검찰이 ‘윤석열 정부 실세’라고 불렸던 황모 전 대통령실 행정관을 음주운전 혐의로 재판에 넘겼다. 12일 서울중앙지검 형사3부(부장검사 최재만)는 지난주 황 전 행정관을 도로교통법 위반 혐의로 불구속 기소했다고 밝혔다. 황 전 행정관은 지난해 12월 16일 강남역 인근 도로에서 약 100m를 음주 상태로 운전한 혐의를 받는다. 당시 황 전 행정관의 혈중 알코올 농도는 0.123%로 면허 취소 수준이었던 것으로 나타났다. 황 전 행정관의 음주운전 이력은 이번이 처음이 아닌 것으로 알려졌다. 검찰은 경찰로부터 사건을 넘겨받아 추가 조사...

items.title: 발달장애인 연주자 ‘숨은 보석’ 찾는다
items.summary: 하트하트재단콩쿠르 영상 심사3월 7일 본선 무대… 8명 결선하트-하트재단은 발달장애인의 사회 통합을 돕고 발달장애인 연주자를 발굴하고자 ‘제4회 하트하트음악콩쿠르’를 개최한다고 12일 밝혔다. 행사는 중·고등부와 대학 및 성인부의 발달장애인을 대상으로 하며, 참가 부문은 피아노, 현악, 관·타악, 성악으로 나뉜다.  연주 영상 심사를 통과한 참가자는 3월7일 한국예술종합학교 이강숙홀에서 열리는 본선에 진출한다.  본선에 뽑힌 부문별 금상 수상자 8명은 재단 리사이틀홀에서 열리는 결선 경연에 참여하며, 이 가운데 대상 수상자 1명이 ...

items.title: "사망자 2천명 넘을 수도" 심상치 않은 이란…트럼프 개입?

"이란 도울 준비 됐다"…'무력 카드' 만지작

items.summary: UNIST 장지현 교수팀 기술 개발도서 지역 식수해결 큰 도움될 듯   전력 없이 태양광만으로 바닷물을 가열해 식수로 바꿀 수 있는 기술이 나왔다. 전력 인프라가 부족한 개발도상국이나 도서 지역의 식수난 해결에 큰 도움이 될 전망이다.  울산과학기술원(UNIST)은 에너지화학공학과 장지현(사진) 교수팀이 햇빛을 받아 바닷물을 가열하는 3원계 산화물 기반 증발기를 개발했다고 12일 밝혔다.  연구팀이 개발한 증발기를 바닷물에 띄워 놓으면 1㎡ 크기에서 1시간 만에 약 4.1ℓ의 식수를 생산할 수 있는 수준이다. 자연적인 해수 증발 속...

items.title: "태양이 두개인 거 모르나? 김건희 여사용 보고서도 올리세요"
items.summary: 「실록 윤석열 시대 2」「제3회 김건희의 전횡, 어떻게 가능했을까」같이 나갈까?2022년 3월 10일 새벽 서울 서초동 아크로비스타. 막 ‘대통령 당선인’이 된 윤석열 국민의힘 대선 후보가 ‘예비 영부인’ 김건희 여사에게 제안했다. (이하 경칭 생략)김건희는 즉답을 내놓지 않았다. 이런저런 논란과 ‘사고’ 때문에 대선 기간 내내 어둠 속에 숨어있던 그였다. 이제 양지로 나가도 될까? 한참을 고민하던 그가 무겁게 입을 열었다.아무래도 안 되겠어요. 아직은 아닌 것 같아요.2022는 3월 10일 새벽 20대 대선 개표 결과 당선이 확정된 윤석열 당시 국민의힘 대선 후보가 당사로 향하기 위해 자택을 나서면서 지지자들과 인사하고 있다. 우상조기자윤석열은 결국 첫 번째 당선사례를 부인 없이 혼자 해야 했다. 하지만 김건희도 영부인이 된 소회와 각오를 밝히지 않은 건 아니었다. 중앙일보와의 서면 인터뷰를 통해서다.해외에서는 대통령 배우자가 직업을 유지하거나 정치적 메시지를 내는 사례가 늘고 있

items.title: 무주택자 고액 전세대출도 DSR 규제
items.summary: 정부가 무주택자의 고액 전세대출도 총부채원리금상환비율(DSR)에 포함하는 방안을 추진한다. 지난해 고강도 가계대출 규제를 잇달아 내놨지만, 수도권 아파트값이 잡히지 않고 전체 가계대출 규모가 빠르게 불어나서다.12일 금융권에 따르면 정부는 다음달 새로운 가계대출 수요 관리 정책을 발표하기 위해 관련 작업에 나섰다. 현재 1주택자의 수도권·규제지역 전세대출에만 적용하는 DSR 규제를 고액 전세대출을 받은 무주택자로 확대하는 게 골자다.금융당국은 DSR 규제 대상을 확정하기 위해 전세대출(보증금) 규모에 따른 정책 영향을 평가하는 시뮬레이션 작업에 들어갔다. 전세시장 충격을 최소화하면서 대출 규제 효과를 극대화하기 위해서다. 예컨대 무주택자의 전세대출이 7억원 또는 10억원 이상 고액일 경우 DSR 규제를 선별적으로 적용하는 식이다. 무주택자 전세대출에 따른 이자분이 DSR에 포함되면 그만큼 대출 한도가 쪼그라든다.금융당국은 그간 서민 주거 안정을 이유로 전세대출을 DSR 적용 대상에서

items.summary: 팽현성 KB오토텍 대표가 차량 공조 기술에 관해 설명하고 있다.  원종환 기자지난 9일 충남 아산에 있는 KB오토텍 본사에선 작업자 대여섯 명이 ‘전기버스용 배터리 열 관리 시스템’을 적용한 냉난방 제품을 조립하는 데 한창이었다. 전기 냉난방 장치(히트펌프)를 부착한 이 제품은 올해 초 양산을 시작해 현대자동차에 납품할 예정이다. 5일 취임한 팽현성 KB오토텍 대표는 “지난해 50억원을 투자해 차세대 트럭에 들어갈 냉난방공조(HVAC) 생산 라인을 늘렸다”며 “지난해 흑자 전환한 데 이어 기술 격차를 벌려 업계를 선도할 것”이라고 말했다.◇ 포터 트럭 공조 장치 독점코스닥시장 상장사 KBI메탈의 비상장 계열사 KB오토텍은 자동차 냉난방공조 전문 업체다. 외국인 근로자 없이 국내 임직원 500여 명이 제품 설계와 생산, 풍동 실험 등 전 공정을 자체적으로 처리한다. 200억원을 들여 지은 풍동 실험실은 온도와 습도, 풍속 등을 자유자재로 조절할 수 있다. 국내 최대 규모로 극한의 기후

items.title: CRISPR Epigenetic Editing Breakthrough: Gene Activation Without DNA Cutting
items.summary: UNSW Sydney researchers developed a new form of CRISPR technology that activates genes by removing methyl groups without cutting DNA, potentially making gene therapy safer. This epigenetic editing approach avoids cancer risks associated with DNA cutting and has been published in Nature Communications.
items.raw_content: The latest version, known as epigenetic editing, takes a different approach - by removing methyl groups from genes that have been silenced, researchers can restore gene activity without altering the underlying DNA sequence. Whenever you cut DNA, there's a risk of cancer, and this approach avoids those risks.

items.title: Real-Time Plant Respiration Monitoring Technology
items.summary: Scientists created a breakthrough method to watch plants breathe in real-time and high definition, tracking exact carbon and water exchange with air. This could unlock development of crops that grow smarter, stronger, and more drought-resistant.
items.raw_content: Scientists have created a new way to watch plants breathe—live and in high definition—while tracking exactly how much carbon and water they exchange with the air. The breakthrough could help unlock crops that grow smarter, stronger, and more drought-resistant.

items.title: Quantum Computing Hardware-Software Co-Design Strategy (SurgeQ)
items.summary: New research on SurgeQ presents a hardware-software co-design strategy for superconducting quantum platforms employing coupling-strengthened faster two-qubit gates while mitigating crosstalk through tailored scheduling. Accepted by DATE 2026 conference.
items.raw_content: SurgeQ, a hardware-software co-design strategy for superconducting quantum platforms that employs coupling-strengthened faster two-qubit gates while mitigating crosstalk through tailored scheduling. Work accepted by DATE 2026.

items.title: Quantum Computing Accelerates Machine Learning Training Time
items.summary: Quantum computing is demonstrating ability to speed up machine learning algorithms and reduce time needed to process vast datasets. Large language models like those used by ChatGPT could potentially be trained in hours rather than weeks through quantum acceleration.
items.raw_content: At the intersection of quantum computing and AI, quantum computing is showing it can speed up machine learning algorithms and reduce the time needed to crunch through vast datasets, meaning algorithms like large language models used by ChatGPT could be trained in hours rather than weeks.

items.title: DeepSeek R1: Chinese Open-Source AI Model Shocks Silicon Valley
items.summary: DeepSeek released R1 in January 2026, shocking the AI industry. MIT Technology Review predicts more Silicon Valley apps will ship on top of Chinese open models in 2026, with the lag between Chinese releases and Western frontier shrinking from months to weeks.
items.raw_content: The last year shaped up as a big one for Chinese open-source models, with DeepSeek releasing R1 in January and shocking the world. In 2026, expect more Silicon Valley apps to ship on top of Chinese open models, with the lag between Chinese releases and Western frontier shrinking from months to weeks.

items.title: AI Economic Impact Measurement: High-Frequency Dashboards Emerge
items.summary: Stanford HAI experts predict 2026 will see emergence of high-frequency AI economic dashboards with monthly updates rather than years-later data. This follows their 'Canaries in the Coal Mine' work with ADP showing early-career workers in AI-exposed occupations experiencing weaker outcomes.
items.raw_content: Arguments about AI's economic impact will give way to careful measurement, with the emergence of high-frequency AI economic dashboards. Similar to their Canaries in the Coal Mine work with ADP showing early-career workers in AI-exposed occupations experiencing weaker outcomes, indicators will be updated monthly rather than years later.

items.title: IMF World Economic Outlook Update (January 2026)
items.summary: IMF scheduled press briefing for World Economic Outlook Update on January 19, 2026 at 10:30 AM CET. Previous projections indicated global growth at 3.3% for both 2025 and 2026, below historical average of 3.7%, with global headline inflation declining to 3.5% in 2026.
items.raw_content: Global growth is projected at 3.3 percent both in 2025 and 2026, below the historical (2000–19) average of 3.7 percent. Global headline inflation is expected to decline to 4.2 percent in 2025 and to 3.5 percent in 2026.

items.title: Renewables to Surpass Coal as Largest Electricity Source by Mid-2026
items.summary: IEA Renewables 2025 report forecasts renewables will surpass coal by end of 2025 or mid-2026 at latest to become largest source of global electricity generation. Share of renewables in global electricity generation projected to rise from 32% in 2024 to 43% by 2030.
items.raw_content: Renewables are expected to surpass coal at the end of 2025 (or by mid-2026 at the latest, depending on hydropower availability) to become the largest source of electricity generation globally. The share of renewables in global electricity generation is projected to rise from 32% in 2024 to 43% by 2030.

items.title: EU Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) Enters Full Implementation
items.summary: Starting January 1, 2026, the EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism moves from transitional period into definitive application phase, placing charges on certain imports of carbon-intensive goods including steel, cement, aluminum, and fertilizers.
items.raw_content: Starting January 1, 2026, the EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (EU CBAM) moves from its transitional period into the definitive application phase, placing charges on certain imports of carbon-intensive goods into the EU, including steel, cement, aluminum, and fertilizers.

items.title: Carbon Engineering's Stratos: World's Largest Direct Air Capture Plant
items.summary: By 2026, Carbon Engineering's Stratos facility in Texas will capture between 500,000 and 1 million tons of CO2 annually, making it the world's largest DAC (Direct Air Capture) plant. Three companies dominate carbon capture: Climeworks, Carbon Engineering, and SLB Capturi.
items.raw_content: By 2026, Carbon Engineering's Stratos facility in Texas will capture between 500,000 and 1 million tons of CO₂ annually, making it the world's largest DAC plant. Three companies now dominate this space: Climeworks, Carbon Engineering, and SLB Capturi.

items.title: CFR Identifies Five Major Foreign Policy Trends for 2026
items.summary: Council on Foreign Relations experts identified five major foreign policy trends shaping 2026, including critical minerals geopolitics, continuing change in regional security architectures, and intensifying geopolitical rivalry with uncertain progress on U.S. critical-minerals supply chain security.
items.raw_content: 2026 is expected to be marked by continuing change in regional security architectures and intensifying geopolitical rivalry, with uncertain progress on U.S. critical-minerals supply chain security.

items.title: South Korea Gen Z Shows 33% Population Share, MZ Generation Dominance
items.summary: MZ Generation (Millennials and Gen Z combined) makes up 33% of South Korea's population as of November 2025. Over half of Gen MZ live in or around the Seoul metropolitan area. Characterized by YOLO (prioritizing personal happiness), 'meaning out' (value-based consumption), and 'flex' (consumption to show existence).
items.raw_content: The MZ Generation makes up 33% of South Korea's population as of November 2025. Over half of Gen MZ live in or around the Seoul metropolitan area. Gen MZ in Korea is characterized by YOLO (prioritizing personal happiness), meaning out (value-based consumption), and flex (consumption to show off one's existence).

items.title: Gen Z Gravitates Toward Intentional Living and Emotional Grounding in 2026
items.summary: Major theme for Gen Z in 2026 is intentional living and emotional grounding, with the generation gravitating toward slower, more meaningful experiences that provide emotional comfort and stability. This represents a shift away from fast-paced consumption patterns.
items.raw_content: A major theme for Gen Z in 2026 is intentional living and emotional grounding, with the generation gravitating toward slower, more meaningful experiences that provide emotional comfort and stability.

items.title: Wellness Trends 2026: Nervous System Regulation and Soft Wellness
items.summary: 2026 wellness trends focus on stimulating the vagus nerve for stress regulation, mind-body practices around nervous system regulation and emotional balance. Movement away from hustle culture toward 'soft wellness' - a gentler, more mindful approach to health. Includes sound baths, astrology sessions, moon ceremonies.
items.raw_content: In 2026, we'll focus on stimulating the vagus nerve, a key pathway in the body's stress-regulation system. Mind-body practices that surround nervous system regulation, resilience and emotional balance are emerging as core wellness pillars. As we move away from the pressures of hustle culture, 2026 is shaping up to be the year of soft wellness.

items.title: NASA Selects Technology for Habitable Worlds Observatory
items.summary: NASA announced selection of industry proposals to advance technologies for Habitable Worlds Observatory concept - the first mission that would directly image Earth-like planets around stars like our Sun and study their atmospheres for signs of life.
items.raw_content: NASA announced the selection of industry proposals to advance technologies for the agency's Habitable Worlds Observatory concept – the first mission that would directly image Earth-like planets around stars like our Sun and study the chemical composition of their atmospheres for signs of life.

items.title: First-Ever ISS Medical Evacuation: Crew-11 Returns Early
items.summary: NASA returning four astronauts to Earth early from ISS due to medical concern, marking first time in U.S. history and ISS program that a space mission has been cut short due to medical issue. SpaceX Crew-11 undocking targeted for no earlier than Jan 14, 2026.
items.raw_content: This marks the first time in U.S. history, as well as in the ISS program, that a space mission has been cut short due to a medical issue. NASA and SpaceX are targeting no earlier than 5 p.m. EST, Wednesday, Jan. 14, for the undocking of the agency's SpaceX Crew-11 mission.

items.title: Artemis II Lunar Flyby Mission Set for February 2026
items.summary: NASA announced earliest launch window for Artemis II is Feb 6, 2026, with 12 possible dates from February-April. Mission will send astronauts around the Moon on ten-day lunar flyby, first crewed lunar flyby since Apollo program.
items.raw_content: NASA announced that the earliest launch window for Artemis II is Feb. 6, 2026, with 12 more possible dates available from February-April. NASA plans to launch the Artemis 2 mission on the Space Launch System sending astronauts around the Moon on a ten-day lunar flyby in early February 2026.

items.title: xAI Raises Record $20 Billion Funding Round
items.summary: First full week of 2026 brought a $20 billion funding round for Elon Musk's xAI, marking one of the largest venture deals ever recorded. Signals continued massive capital deployment in AI infrastructure.
items.raw_content: The first full week of 2026 brought a $20 billion funding round for Elon Musk's xAI, marking one of the largest venture deals ever recorded.

items.title: AI Startups Dominate VC: 58% of Funding in Megarounds Over $500M
items.summary: More than half of all VC dollars and 36% of total deals now flow to AI companies. Two out of every three VC dollars went to AI ventures in 2025. In AI sector, 58% of funding was in megarounds of $500 million or more, with 2025 AI startup funding reaching $131.5B, growing 52% while non-AI funding dropped 10%.
items.raw_content: More than half of all VC dollars—and 36% of total deals—now flow to AI companies. Two out of every three VC dollars went to AI ventures in 2025. AI startups attracted about 131.5 billion dollars in venture funding, growing roughly 52 percent while funding to non AI startups slipped almost 10 percent. In AI, 58% of funding was in megarounds of $500 million or more.

items.title: Boston Dynamics Atlas: Electric Humanoid Robot Deployments Begin
items.summary: Boston Dynamics unveiled all-new Electric Atlas at CES 2026, a high-performance enterprise-grade humanoid robot for industrial tasks from material handling to order fulfillment. 2026 deployments fully allocated, with initial fleets shipping to Hyundai's RMAC and Google DeepMind.
items.raw_content: Boston Dynamics unveiled its all-new Electric Atlas, a high-performance, enterprise-grade humanoid robot designed to carry out a wide range of industrial tasks, from material handling to order fulfilment. Boston Dynamics' Atlas deployments for 2026 are already fully allocated, with initial fleets set to ship to Hyundai's Robotics Metaplant Application Center (RMAC) and Google DeepMind.

items.title: Hyundai Plans 30,000 Humanoid Robots Annual Production by 2028
items.summary: Hyundai announced at CES 2026 plans to start using humanoid robots in its factories and is building production system that could produce 30,000 robots annually by 2028. Part of broader AI Robotics Strategy to lead human-centered robotics era.
items.raw_content: Hyundai said at CES 2026 that it plans to start using humanoid robots in its factories and is building a production system that could produce 30,000 robots annually by 2028.

items.title: World's First Production Solid-State EV Battery: 5-Minute Charging
items.summary: Donut Lab unveiled production-ready solid-state EV battery at CES 2026 that recharges fully in five minutes. Battery has 400 Wh/kg energy density (double typical Tesla battery) and can be fully charged in 5 minutes for up to 100,000 cycles. Verge Motorcycles TS Pro to be first production vehicle with all-solid-state battery in Q1 2026.
items.raw_content: Donut Lab unveiled a production-ready solid-state EV battery at CES 2026 that recharges fully in five minutes. The battery has an energy density of 400 watt-hours/kilogram, which is double the density of a typical Tesla battery, and can be fully charged in five minutes for as many as 100,000 cycles.

items.title: CATL Sodium-Ion Batteries to Enter Mass Production in 2026
items.summary: Battery market leader CATL announced commercial production at scale of sodium-ion batteries starting in 2026 for battery swapping systems, passenger vehicles, commercial vehicles, and stationary storage. Sodium-based batteries promise better low-temperature performance, improved safety, and lower costs than lithium.
items.raw_content: Battery market leader CATL announced that it would start commercial production at scale of sodium-ion batteries in 2026. The company said its sodium-ion cells will be used in battery swapping systems, passenger vehicles, commercial vehicles, and stationary energy storage. Sodium-based batteries promise better low-temperature performance, improved safety, and lower costs.

items.title: South Korea Semiconductor Exports Projected to Reach $188B in 2026
items.summary: South Korea's semiconductor exports in 2026 projected to reach $188 billion, an 11% increase compared to last year, marking new all-time high for second consecutive year. Korean chipmakers expected to increase spending on semiconductor manufacturing equipment by 27.2% to $29.66B.
items.raw_content: South Korea's semiconductor exports in 2026 are projected to reach $188 billion, an 11% increase compared to last year. This would mark a new all-time high for the second consecutive year. South Korean chipmakers are expected to increase spending on semiconductor manufacturing equipment by 27.2% to $29.66 billion.

items.title: AI Integration Shifts from Pilot Projects to System-Wide Education Strategy
items.summary: 2026 marks transition from experimental AI adoption to system-wide integration in education. AI shifting from pilot projects to natural part of daily classroom experiences, firmly cemented as essential part of institutional strategy. Hyper-personalized learning becoming standard with AI adapting instruction based on individual readiness.
items.raw_content: 2026 is poised to mark a transition from experimental AI adoption to system-wide integration, with AI shifting from pilot projects to a natural part of daily classroom experiences. AI is no longer a collection of pilots and curiosities but is firmly cemented as an essential part of institutional strategy.

items.title: US Stablecoin Regulation: GENIUS Act Implementation by July 2026
items.summary: GENIUS Act creates federal regulatory framework for stablecoin issuers, mandating requirements around reserves, audits, and financial integrity. Regulators expected to promulgate final implementing regulations by July 2026, ahead of January 2027 deadline to bring GENIUS into force.
items.raw_content: The GENIUS Act creates a federal regulatory framework for stablecoin issuers, mandating requirements around reserves, audits, and financial integrity, with regulators expected to promulgate final implementing regulations by July 2026, ahead of a deadline of January 2027 to bring GENIUS into force.

items.title: Federal Reserve 'Skinny' Master Accounts for Fintech by Q4 2026
items.summary: On December 19, Fed issued RFI on 'skinny' master accounts providing access to Federal Reserve payment rails while limiting features like discount window access. FRB's goal is to have skinny master accounts available by Q4 2026, enabling fintech access to Fed infrastructure.
items.raw_content: On December 19, the Fed issued a request for information seeking public input on so-called skinny master accounts, which would provide access to Federal Reserve payment rails while limiting or excluding features such as discount window access. The FRB's goal is to have skinny master accounts available by the fourth quarter of 2026.

items.title: Labor Market Enters 'Low-Hire, Low-Fire' Era with 11.7% Jobs Automatable
items.summary: November MIT study found 11.7% of jobs could already be automated using AI. 2026 predicted as 'year of agents' as software expands from making humans productive to automating work itself. Labor market forecast for 'low-hire, low-fire' trend with companies hoarding talent while using AI to fill gaps. Jobs with more AI exposure seeing slower job growth, especially among younger workers.
items.raw_content: A November MIT study found an estimated 11.7% of jobs could already be automated using AI. 2026 will be the year of agents as software expands from making humans more productive to automating work itself. There are no signs of large-scale job displacement, but jobs with more AI exposure have seen slower job growth, especially among younger workers.

items.title: AI Workers Save 2 Hours Daily but Only 25% Receive Formal Training
items.summary: Workers report saving average of two hours per day using AI tools, yet only 25% receive formal AI training from employers. Workers with AI expertise can command salaries up to 56% higher than peers, more than double the premium from year before. Highlights significant training gap organizations need to address in 2026.
items.raw_content: Workers report saving an average of two hours per day using AI tools, yet only 25% receive formal AI training from their employers, highlighting a significant training gap. Workers with AI expertise can now command salaries up to 56% higher than peers, more than double the premium from the year before.

items.title: US-China Tech De-escalation: Rare Earth Export Controls Suspended
items.summary: Beijing retaliated to US semiconductor controls with rare-earth export licensing requirements. Escalation jolted global markets, forcing emergency consultations in Busan where both sides agreed to tentative one-year suspension of measures. US-China relations entering 2026 with paradox: trade thawing in soybeans/metals while tech war over AI chips hardening.
items.raw_content: Beijing retaliated with new licensing requirements on rare-earth oxides, metals, and magnet products. The escalation jolted global markets and forced emergency consultations in Busan, South Korea, where both sides agreed to a tentative one-year suspension of their measures. US-China relations are entering 2026 with a paradox: trade is thawing in soybeans and metals, while the tech war over AI chips is hardening.

items.title: China Reduces Import Tariffs on 935 Items Targeting Tech and Healthcare
items.summary: Beginning January 1, 2026, China reduced import duties on 935 items to levels below Most-Favored-Nation rates. 2026 tariff schedule includes reductions on critical components for advanced and emerging technologies, renewable energy, and healthcare. Signals pragmatic trade policy shift.
items.raw_content: Beginning January 1, China will reduce import duties on 935 items to levels below Most-Favored-Nation rates. The 2026 tariff schedule includes tariff reductions on critical components and materials related to advanced and emerging technologies, renewable energy, and healthcare in particular.

items.title: USC Stem Cell Implant Trial for Vision Restoration in Macular Degeneration
items.summary: Scientists at USC launching new trial to test tiny stem cell implant that could restore vision in people with advanced dry macular degeneration. Represents breakthrough in regenerative medicine for age-related vision loss.
items.raw_content: Scientists at USC are launching a new trial to test a tiny stem cell implant that could restore vision in people with advanced dry macular degeneration.

items.title: AI Sleep Analysis Predicts Future Disease Risk from One Night's Data
items.summary: Stanford researchers developed AI that can predict future disease risk using data from just one night of sleep, analyzing detailed physiological signals across brain, heart, and breathing. Represents advancement in preventive medicine and early disease detection.
items.raw_content: Stanford researchers have developed an AI that can predict future disease risk using data from just one night of sleep, analyzing detailed physiological signals across the brain, heart, and breathing.

items.title: Obesity Drug Access Inequality: Two-Tier System Emerges
items.summary: King's College London research published January 4, 2026 highlights that breakthrough obesity drugs (GLP-1) are not accessible to everyone, raising concerns about two-tier system where wealth rather than medical need determines access to care. Critical social equity issue in healthcare.
items.raw_content: King's College London published research highlighting that breakthrough obesity drugs are not accessible to everyone, raising concerns about a two-tier system where wealth, rather than medical need, determines access to care.

items.title: FDA to Approve First Regulatory T Cell Therapy by Spring 2026
items.summary: As soon as spring 2026, FDA could approve first regulatory T cell therapy to prevent graft-versus-host disease in bone marrow transplant recipients. Represents major advancement in cell-based immunotherapy.
items.raw_content: As soon as the spring of 2026, the FDA could approve the first regulatory T cell therapy that could prevent graft-versus-host disease in bone marrow transplant recipients.

items.title: Generation Alpha Takes Over Social Media in 2026
items.summary: Gen Alpha (born 2010-2024) is officially logging on to social media with years of pre-usage experience, driving a social video boom. YouTube will overtake linear TV in viewership among US children by 2026.

items.title: Gen X Becomes World's Largest Wealth Center in 2026
items.summary: By 2026, Generation X is poised to become the world's largest wealth center, as more individuals become High-Net-Worth Individuals. More than half of the CEOs of Fortune 500 companies are from Gen X.

items.title: Millennials and Gen Z to Dominate Workforce by 2030
items.summary: Millennials and Gen Z are projected to be roughly 74% of the global workforce by 2030. 47% of Millennials are reflecting on the simpler life of the 1990s and early 2000s, embracing nostalgia by reviving Y2K fashion.

items.title: U.S. Fertility Rate Drops to 1.58 Births per Woman in 2026
items.summary: CBO projects that the total fertility rate will equal 1.58 births per woman in 2026, declining to 1.53 in 2036. The Social Security area population is projected to increase from 349 million people this year to 364 million in 2056.

items.title: IBM Announces 2026 as Year Quantum Outperforms Classical Computing
items.summary: IBM has publicly stated that 2026 will mark the first time a quantum computer will be able to outperform a classical computer. This milestone will unlock breakthroughs in drug development, materials science, financial optimization and more industries facing incredibly complex challenges.

items.title: D-Wave Announces First Major Quantum Breakthrough of 2026
items.summary: D-Wave announced an industry-first breakthrough demonstrating scalable, on-chip cryogenic control for gate-model qubits, claiming it is the first in the industry to do so. This marks a significant step toward practical quantum computing.

items.title: Tesla Plans 50,000 Optimus Humanoid Robots at $20K-30K in 2026
items.summary: Tesla plans to produce 50,000 Optimus humanoid robot units in 2026 at a price point of $20,000-30,000. Experts predict humanoid robots will appear in industrial settings in significant numbers by 2026-2028.

items.title: AI-Quantum Convergence Emerges as Unified Force in 2026
items.summary: 2026 could emerge as an inflection point where AI and quantum computing cease to be parallel innovations and start functioning as a unified force, with quantum processors potentially compressing years of AI-driven optimization into hours, particularly in drug discovery and materials science.

items.title: Physical AI and Robotics Dominate CES 2026
items.summary: Robotics descended upon CES 2026 as 'physical AI,' turning breakthroughs in artificial intelligence into adaptable machines capable of delivering complex real-world outcomes. Humanoid robots are emerging as a major frontier, moving from single-task roles toward collaborative assistants.

items.title: Goldman Sachs Projects 2.8% Global Growth in 2026
items.summary: Goldman Sachs Research economists expect sturdy global growth of 2.8% in 2026, versus a consensus forecast of 2.5%. The G20 countries, which account for roughly 80% of total global GDP, are projected to grow by 2.9% next year.

items.title: U.S. Expected to Outperform with 2.6% Growth in 2026
items.summary: The US is likely to outperform substantially with 2.6% growth (vs. 2.0% consensus) because of reduced tariff drag, tax cuts, and easier financial conditions. Solid GDP growth in 2026 is expected around 2% with core inflation moderating to 2.7%.

items.title: All Wall Street Forecasters Predict Stock Rally for Fourth Consecutive Year
items.summary: Every Wall Street forecaster tracked by Bloomberg is predicting that stocks will rally for a fourth consecutive year. J.P. Morgan Global Research estimates the AI supercycle driving above-trend earnings growth of 13-15% for at least the next two years.

items.title: AI Called 'Defining Theme for Equity Markets' in 2026
items.summary: AI is called 'the defining theme for equity markets' in 2026, with the tech likely to 'keep trumping tariffs and traditional macro drivers.' The macro environment will continue to be unstable given policy crosscurrents and a wobbly labor market.

items.title: G20 Inflation to Slow from 3.4% to 2.8% in 2026
items.summary: Headline inflation among G20 countries is expected to slow down further next year from 3.4% to 2.8% cumulatively. Valuations of key assets remain elevated, with many equities looking pricey and credit spreads extremely tight.

items.title: Trump Pulls U.S. Out of Major Climate Organizations
items.summary: The U.S. has announced withdrawal from major international climate and clean energy organizations, including the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), IPCC, and International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA).

items.title: Global Solar Installations Surpass 500 GW AC in 2025
items.summary: The end of 2025 marked a high point for renewables installations, with global solar installations surpassing 500 GW AC. Clean technologies will continue to dominate new energy deployments in 2026, with clean energy sources accounting for over 90% of U.S. new power capacity additions.

items.title: U.S. to Install 15 GW of Battery Storage in 2026
items.summary: The U.S. will be installing almost 15 GW of new battery energy storage systems (BESS) capacity in 2026, with Germany and Australia following with 5 GW, and the UK with 3 GW.

items.title: AI Data Centers Drive 17% Increase in Global Power Demand
items.summary: Global data center power demand is projected to increase 17% to 2026 and 14% per year through 2030, potentially reaching over 2,200 TWh, roughly equivalent to India's current total electricity consumption. Microsoft's emissions increased 23.4% since 2020, Google's climbed 51% since 2019, driven by AI.

items.title: 2025 Second-Hottest Year on Record, Carbon Pollution Up 1%
items.summary: 2025 was the second-hottest year on record at Earth's surface, behind only 2024. Global carbon pollution increased by about 1% in 2025, with a 2% increase in the U.S.

items.title: Governments Use Industrial Subsidies to Improve Economic Security
items.summary: Governments will use industrial subsidies, restrictive trade policies, ownership stakes in companies and local investment mandates to improve economic security, with new trade policies including tariffs, export controls and local content requirements to modify existing supply chains and trade patterns.

items.title: EU AI Act Becomes Fully Applicable August 2, 2026
items.summary: The EU AI Act will move from the planning stage to possessing real operational gravity as it becomes fully applicable on Aug. 2, 2026, while other jurisdictions regulate AI and data with different priorities, producing divergence rather than convergence in global AI balkanization.

items.title: U.S. Foreign Aid Slashed to $38.4 Billion in FY2025
items.summary: The Donald Trump administration has slashed the United States' foreign aid this year, with enacted foreign aid dropping to $38.4 billion for fiscal year 2025, with additional rescissions cutting this number by at least $9.4 billion.

items.title: Water Rights Conflicts to Rise Amid Semiconductor and AI Demand
items.summary: As freshwater scarcity grows in markets around the world and demand for water increases for semiconductor manufacturing and cooling data centers, more water rights conflicts will arise in 2026.

items.title: Mindfulness Linked to Brain Changes in Memory and Emotion Centers
items.summary: Studies have shown a link between practicing mindfulness and measurable changes in the regions of the brain related to memory, emotion, and learning. In 2026, wellness trends promote meditation, sound healing and relaxation as daily rituals to help with stress management.

items.title: Spirituality Shows Lasting Positive Effects on Mental Health in 2026
items.summary: Research shows that spirituality—be it through traditional religion, meditation, crystal healing or something of your own making—can have lasting, positive effects on mental health, self-esteem, anger management, and physical health in 2026. Practices such as meditating, yoga, and living in alignment with values help contribute to spiritual wellness.

items.title: 2026 Heralds Return of Connection as Pillar of Health
items.summary: After years of digital-first interaction, 2026 heralds the return of connection as a pillar of health. Community circles, wellness dinners, hobby-based meetups, and restorative group rituals will become more popular as people seek meaningful, in-person relationships.

items.title: Holistic Wellness Approach Gains Momentum in 2026
items.summary: In the context of wellness, the term 'holistic' refers to an approach that considers a person in all their dimensions, rather than treating an isolated symptom or part of the body. Energy, lifestyle, emotions, physical and mental health are all interconnected. The theme for 2026 is preventive, personalized, and integrated wellness that honors the mind-body-spirit connection.

items.title: NVIDIA Vera Rubin Platform Launch - Next-Gen AI Supercomputer
items.description: NVIDIA unveiled Vera Rubin at CES 2026, its next-generation AI chip platform featuring six new chips for AI supercomputing. First products arriving second half of 2026. Includes Gr00t vision language models for humanoid robots.

items.title: Boston Dynamics-Google DeepMind Partnership for Gemini-Powered Atlas Robots
items.description: Boston Dynamics partnered with Google DeepMind to integrate Gemini AI into Atlas humanoid robots. Strategic collaboration with Hyundai to accelerate next-generation humanoid development.
items.source: CES 2026, Morocco World News, Hyundai Press

items.title: Lyte Robotics Emerges from Stealth with $107M to Improve Robot Vision
items.description: Former Apple Face ID engineers launched Lyte Robotics with $107M funding from Fidelity, Atreides Management, and others. Developing technology to help robots see better and move more safely.

items.title: xAI Closes $20B Funding Round with NVIDIA Backing
items.description: Elon Musk's xAI completed $20 billion funding round from investors including NVIDIA, Valor Equity Partners, and Qatar Investment Authority. Major AI infrastructure investment.

items.title: IBM Declares 2026 as Year of Quantum Advantage
items.description: IBM publicly stated 2026 will mark first time quantum computers outperform classical computers, achieving quantum advantage. AI and quantum systems beginning to operate as mutually reinforcing stack.

items.title: Complex-Valued Neural Networks for Quantum Dynamics Prediction
items.description: New arXiv paper (2601.03964) introduces complex-valued neural networks for learning quantum dissipative dynamics, outperforming real-valued networks in convergence speed and physical fidelity.

items.title: Molecular Devices with Dynamic Role-Switching Capability
items.description: Scientists developed molecular devices that switch roles between memory, logic, and learning elements within same structure through precise chemical design allowing dynamic electron reorganization.

items.title: CRISPR-GPT AI Co-Pilot Automates Gene Editing Workflows
items.description: First agentic AI co-pilot for gene editing, CRISPR-GPT automates design, execution, and analysis of experiments, reducing experimental cycles from weeks to hours.

items.title: FDA Approves First Therapy for TA-TMA (YARTEMLEA)
items.description: Omeros' YARTEMLEA received FDA approval for hematopoietic stem cell transplant-associated thrombotic microangiopathy, first and only approved therapy for this fatal complication. Launch January 2026.

items.title: Immune Cell Atlas Reveals East-West Differences
items.description: Giant functional atlas of immune cells in Chinese cohort published in Nature reveals crucial differences with European and Japanese datasets, advancing personalized medicine.

items.title: Quantum-Informed ML Framework for Sensing Materials
items.description: arXiv paper introduces MORE-ML, computational framework integrating quantum-mechanical property data with ML to predict sensing-relevant properties in artificial materials.

items.title: Artemis 2 Moon Mission Rollout January 17
items.description: NASA rolling out rocket for Artemis 2 moon mission on January 17, launching no earlier than February 5. First lunar excursion with crew in over 50 years with 3 NASA + 1 Canadian astronaut.

items.title: AI Upskilling Becomes Existential Priority for Organizations
items.description: 89% say workforce needs improved AI skills but only 6% began meaningful upskilling. 80% of engineering workforce needs reskilling through 2027. Workers with AI skills command 56% wage premiums.

items.title: Gen Z Comprises 27% of Workforce in 2026, Demands Flexibility
items.description: Gen Z now 27% of workforce, will reach 30% by 2030. 72% most likely to leave jobs without flexible work policies. Half refuse jobs misaligned with social/environmental values.

items.title: Generation Alpha Dominates Social Media with 64% Daily YouTube/TikTok Use
items.description: 64% of US children aged 8-12 use YouTube or TikTok daily. Nearly two-thirds ages 8-10 spend up to 4 hours daily on social media. 38% create content rather than just consume.

items.title: Generation Alpha's Economic Impact to Reach $5.46 Trillion by 2029
items.description: Gen Alpha's direct and indirect economic impact projected at $5.46 trillion globally by 2029, driven by household influence and early brand loyalty.

items.title: Remote Work Tensions Escalate with 'Empowered Non-Compliers'
items.description: 30% of organizations plan to reduce/eliminate remote work in 2026. High-value employees ignore office mandates. 70% prefer hybrid/remote, 85% say remote work is #1 job application factor.

items.title: U.S. Labor Participation Rate to Dip to 60.4% by 2030
items.description: U.S. labor participation rate projected to decline from 61.7% (2020) to 60.4% by 2030. Reflects aging population and demographic shifts impacting workforce availability.

items.title: Japan's Fertility Rate Hits Historic Low of 1.15 in 2024
items.description: Japan's total fertility rate dropped to 1.15 in 2024, lowest ever recorded. Median age 50.8 years. Only 758,631 babies born in 2023, lowest since 1899. Population projected at 87M by 2070.

items.title: Europe Projected to Lose 7% Population by 2050
items.description: Europe facing 7% population decrease 2022-2050. Fertility rates at record lows even in family-friendly Nordic countries (Finland: 1.25 in 2024). Two-thirds of global population below 2.1 replacement rate.

items.title: IMF Projects Global Growth at 3.0-3.1% for 2025-2026
items.description: IMF upward revision to 3.0% (2025) and 3.1% (2026) global growth. OECD expects 2.9-3.1%. World Bank more cautious at 2.3% (2025) with tepid 2026-27 recovery due to trade barriers.

items.title: Goldman Sachs Forecasts 'Sturdy' 2.8% Global Growth in 2026
items.description: Goldman Sachs Research projects sturdy global growth of 2.8% in 2026, balancing optimism with persistent uncertainties from trade tensions and geopolitical factors.

items.title: Stablecoin Regulation Implementation Targeted for 2026
items.description: Full stablecoin regulation implementation targeted 2026. GENIUS Act rollout accelerating bank/enterprise adoption. Regulators must finalize rules by July 18, 2026. Includes issuer licensing and rehypothecation prohibitions.

items.title: CFTC 'Crypto Sprint' to Complete by August 2026
items.description: CFTC under Trump administration wrapping up crypto sprint by August 2026. Focus on spot crypto trading, tokenized collateral, blockchain integration. Bitcoin and Ethereum primarily under CFTC as commodities.

items.title: U.S. Organizations Project 3.6% Mean Salary Increases for 2026
items.description: U.S. organizations projecting 3.6% mean salary increase budgets for 2026, signaling cautious economic environment while attempting to retain talent amid tight labor market.

items.title: Science's 2025 Breakthrough: Unstoppable Rise of Renewable Energy
items.description: Science magazine names renewable energy growth as 2025 Breakthrough of Year. Renewables surpassed coal globally. Solar/wind covered entire global electricity use increase Jan-June 2025. Over 800 GW installed.

items.title: Global Storage Installations to Exceed 100GW in 2026
items.description: Annual global energy storage installations expected to exceed 100GW in 2026 for first time. Equipment prices now $117/kWh, less than one-third of three years ago. Critical for grid stability.

items.title: EU Battery Carbon Footprint Labeling Mandatory by August 2026
items.description: Battery carbon footprint labeling becomes mandatory by August 18, 2026 for applicable batteries in EU. From 2027, Commission will set maximum carbon footprint limits. Major supply chain impact.

items.title: Green Hydrogen Projects Coming Online in 2026
items.description: Multiple green hydrogen projects launching 2026: Uniper Dutch project, Air Products NEOM Saudi Arabia complex, Uruguay Kahirós plant. Singapore 600 MW hydrogen-ready powerplant first half 2026.

items.title: Eurasia Group Names U.S. as Principal Source of Global Risk in 2026
items.description: Eurasia Group identifies United States itself as principal source of global risk in 2026. Trump tariff policies, AI race with China, weakened global leadership cited as major concerns.

items.title: Europe Facing 'Intensifying Pressure Campaign' from Trump Administration
items.description: European Commission President's tariff deal stability described as 'pipe dream.' Europe likely facing intensifying pressure campaign from Trump in 2026. Baseline 10% tariff, protective and reciprocal tariffs announced.

items.title: China's Critical Minerals Dominance Puts World on Notice
items.description: China's near-total control over critical minerals and rare earth elements, with demonstrated willingness to weaponize dominance. Beijing restricting global access to minerals and processing technology.

items.title: 62% of Investors Worry About AI-Driven Market Concentration Risk
items.description: Institutional investors cite AI-driven disruption as biggest risk for 2026. 62% worry significant AI technological development could bring concentration risk to equity markets. AI race raises geopolitical stakes.

items.title: Trump Administration Deploys Tariffs as Bargaining Leverage Tool
items.description: Trade friction under Trump becoming more targeted and sector-specific. Deploying tariffs to drive bargaining leverage, reshape investment flows, punish or privilege countries. Geopolitical tensions driving tariff use.

items.title: COP31 Climate Summit Scheduled November 9-20 in Türkiye
items.description: COP31 scheduled November 9-20, 2026 in Antalya, Türkiye. Shared leadership model with Australia driving negotiations. Global Implementation Accelerator delivering report at COP31.

items.title: WEF Global Cooperation Barometer Shows Multilateralism Weakening
items.description: WEF Global Cooperation Barometer 2026 shows overall cooperation unchanged but composition shifting. Multilateralism metrics weakened most. Smaller, flexible arrangements improving in data flows, services trade.

items.title: Wellness Shift from Hustle Culture to Sustainable Holistic Practices
items.description: 2026 wellness theme: shift from hustle culture and biohacking toward sustainable, holistic practices. Balance over optimization. Focus on balance, mindfulness, restoration, connection vs. perfection and extremes.

items.title: Mindfulness Association January 2026 Calendar: Beginner's Mind Theme
items.description: Mindfulness Association released January 2026 calendar centered on Beginner's Mind theme, inviting approach to familiar experiences with curiosity, openness, freshness. Contemplative practice focus.

items.title: Neuro-Health Therapies and Brain-Training Programs in Wellness Resorts
items.description: Wellness resorts incorporating brain-training programmes, neuro-health therapies, mindfulness workshops designed to enhance cognitive function and emotional resilience. Integration of neuroscience and wellness.

items.title: AI 기반 정신건강 앱 시장 급성장 - 연 15% 성장률로 2030년 156억 유로 예상
items.summary: 정신건강 앱 시장이 현재 70억 유로에서 2030년 156억 유로로 성장 예상. AI 기반 챗봇과 가상 코치가 치료사 부족 문제 해결. Flourish, Woebot, Wysa 등 주요 플랫폼이 무작위 대조 실험(RCT)을 통해 효과성 입증 중.
items.raw_content: The global mental health apps market has reached 7 billion euros with growth exceeding 15% annually, with projections indicating the market will reach 15.6 billion euros by 2030. AI-powered solutions including chatbots, virtual coaches, and immersive technologies can effectively assist in developing cognitive, emotional, and behavioral self-regulation skills.

items.title: 미국 일리노이·네바다주, AI 정신건강 치료 금지 법안 통과 - 규제 강화 추세
items.summary: 일리노이와 네바다주가 AI 정신건강 치료를 금지하는 법안 통과. 유타주는 챗봇에 제한 조치. 스탠포드 연구에서 AI 치료 챗봇이 효과 부족하고 위험한 응답 및 낙인 조장 가능성 발견. 미국 청소년 540만 명(13%)이 이미 AI를 정신건강 지원에 사용 중.
items.raw_content: Illinois and Nevada have banned the use of AI to treat mental health, while Utah placed certain limits on therapy chatbots. A Stanford University study found that AI therapy chatbots are both ineffective compared to human therapists and contribute to dangerous responses and harmful stigma. 13% of U.S. youth ages 12-21 (5.4 million young people) are using generative AI for mental health support.

items.title: RENPHO x Headspace 협업 아이 마사지기 출시 - 웰니스 기술과 마음챙김 융합
items.summary: 웰니스 기술 기업 RENPHO와 명상 앱 Headspace가 협업하여 Eyeris Zen 아이 마사지기 출시. 물리적 웰니스 디바이스와 디지털 마음챙김 콘텐츠의 통합 제품. 하드웨어와 소프트웨어 융합형 웰니스 솔루션 트렌드.
items.raw_content: Wellness technology meets mindfulness with the debut of the RENPHO x Headspace Eyeris Zen Eye Massager in early January 2026, representing a collaboration between wellness technology and mindfulness practices.

items.title: 실로시빈(환각버섯 성분) FDA 승인 임박 - 2026-27년 치료제 허가 전망
items.summary: Compass Pathways의 합성 실로시빈이 2026-27년 FDA 신약 승인 신청 예정. 치료 저항성 우울증 치료제로 개발 중. MDMA는 2024년 FDA 승인 거부당했으나, 실로시빈은 내면적 경험 중심으로 승인 가능성 높음. Usona Institute도 2024년 3월 3상 시험 시작.
items.raw_content: Compass Pathways' timeline puts the company on track to present its New Drug Application to the FDA sometime between late 2026 and 2027. If these trials are successful, FDA approval could be granted in 2026. Synthetic psilocybin may have a better chance because psilocybin works very differently - the subjective experience is largely internal.

items.title: 웰니스 관광 시장 2027년 1.4조 달러 돌파 - 일반 관광의 2배 성장률
items.summary: 웰니스 관광 시장이 2027년 1.4조 달러 돌파 예상. 풀문 세레머니, 사운드 배스, 명상 리트릿 등 영적 경험 중심 여행 급증. '조용한 휴가(quietcations)', 스타배싱(starbathing), 다크 리트릿, 샤머니즘 등 깊은 영성 체험 프로그램 확산.
items.raw_content: Wellness tourism is expected to reach over $1.4 trillion by 2027, growing at a rate nearly twice that of general tourism through 2026. The biggest wellness travel trends include full moon ceremonies and sound baths to social spas and ritualistic retreats. There's a rising desire for unplugged 'me time,' 'quietcations,' and solo travel, reflected in an expanding spiritual and mindfulness offer.

items.title: 영성 웰니스 앱 시장 2035년까지 연평균 14.66% 성장 - 99억 달러 규모 전망
items.summary: 영성 웰니스 앱 시장이 2026-2035년 연평균 14.66% 성장하여 2035년 99.1억 달러 도달 예상. 안드로이드 플랫폼이 최대 점유율. 명상, 요가, 감정 웰빙 앱 사용 급증. Isha Foundation의 'Miracle of Mind' 앱은 15시간 만에 100만 다운로드 달성(ChatGPT 초기 속도 초과).
items.raw_content: The spiritual wellness apps market is projected to reach USD 9.91 billion by 2035, growing at a CAGR of 14.66% from 2026 to 2035. In June 2025, a new meditation app from the Isha Foundation 'Miracle of Mind' garnered over a million downloads in just 15 hours, exceeding the initial user adoption speed of ChatGPT.

items.title: 직장 웰빙과 성과 연계 명확화 - 89%가 웰빙 우선시 시 성과 향상 경험
items.summary: 2026년 직장 웰빙 보고서에서 89%의 직원이 웰빙 우선시 시 더 나은 성과를 경험한다고 응답. Z세대 68%가 치료를 필수로 인식(베이비부머 33% 대비). 그러나 전체 웰빙 지수는 2024년 63%에서 2025년 54%로 하락. 재정 웰니스가 68%의 직원에게 전체 웰빙의 장애물.
items.raw_content: 89% of employees perform better when prioritizing wellbeing. Gen Z is leading a cultural shift toward mental health support - 68% say therapy is essential to their wellbeing, compared with 59% of Millennials, 45% of Gen X, and just 33% of Baby Boomers. However, in 2025, just 54% of workers rated their wellbeing as good or thriving, down from 63% in 2024.

items.title: 도파민 단식(Dopamine Fasting) 2.0 - 디지털 디톡스가 세속 종교화
items.summary: 도파민 단식이 실리콘밸리 밈에서 세계적 하위문화로 진화. Reddit r/DopamineDetoxing 커뮤니티 13,000명 이상. 과학적 근거보다는 의례, 수치심, 통제 욕구에 기반한 디지털 금욕주의. 2026년 최대 정신건강 트렌드는 '콘텐츠 다이어트(Content Dieting)'로 예측.
items.raw_content: Content dieting is predicted to become 2026's biggest mental health trend. Dopamine fasting has evolved from a Silicon Valley meme into a global subculture that combines digital detox with secular asceticism. Reddit communities like r/DopamineDetoxing have grown to 13,000 members, becoming digital monasteries for those dealing with distraction and burnout.

items.title: 외로움 전염병(Loneliness Epidemic) 공중보건 위기로 공식화 - 흡연 15개비만큼 치명적
items.summary: 미국 의무총감 비벡 머시가 외로움을 공중보건 전염병으로 선언. 사회적 고립이 하루 담배 15개비만큼 조기 사망 위험 30% 증가. 미국 성인 절반이 외로움 경험, 특히 18-22세 청년층 고립도 최고. 텍사스 A&M 연구팀이 금연 전략을 외로움 해결에 적용 연구 중.
items.raw_content: Surgeon General Vivek Murthy issued an advisory declaring loneliness a public health epidemic. The data shows social isolation is as deadly as smoking 15 cigarettes a day and raises the risk of premature death by nearly 30%. Approximately half of U.S. adults report experiencing loneliness, with those aged 18-22 years having the highest average loneliness score.

items.title: 한국 웰니스 트렌드 2026 - 의식적 호흡법 대중화와 감정 관리 능력화
items.summary: 한국 웰니스 트렌드로 의식적 호흡법이 1990년대 요가 붐 수준으로 대중화. 맥킨지가 명상과 마음챙김을 소비자 지출 증가 범주로 지목. Z세대는 HSP(고감수성) 테스트와 코르티솔 조절을 위한 산책, 격불, 숙면에 집중. 2026년 핵심은 '감정 관리'가 역량으로 인식되는 '메타센싱(Meta-sensing)' 트렌드.
items.raw_content: 의식적인 호흡법이 점차 대중화되고 있으며, 글로벌 웰니스 연구소는 호흡법의 성장세가 1990년대 요가 붐과 비견된다고 평가. Z세대는 HSP 테스트를 통해 자신의 감정적 민감도를 측정하고, 스트레스 호르몬인 코르티솔 조절에 도움이 되는 산책, 격불, 숙면에 관심. 2026년 시대 흐름에서 눈에 띄는 것은 '감정'.

items.title: 한국 종교계 '영성(Spirituality)' 주목 - 종교인구 감소 속 영적 갈망 증가 역설
items.summary: '한국교회트렌드 2026' 보고서에서 '호모 스피리투알리스(영적 갈망을 가진 인간)' 개념 제시. 종교 소속은 감소하나 신자들의 영적 갈망과 성경·영성에 대한 지적 호기심은 증가하는 역설. 영성을 종교 지속가능성의 핵심 역량으로 강조. 제도 종교에서 개인 영성으로의 이동.
items.raw_content: The book 'Korean Church Trend 2026' highlights the concept of 'Homo Spiritualis,' meaning people with hidden spiritual yearning. While religious affiliation has decreased, believers' spiritual longing and intellectual curiosity about the Bible and spirituality have grown. Spirituality is now being emphasized as a core capability that makes religion sustainable.

items.title: 직장 정신건강 '지속적 돌봄 모델(Continuous Care)' 필수화 - 단회 세션 넘어선 통합 지원
items.summary: 2026년 직장 정신건강은 50분 단회 세션을 넘어 '지속적 돌봄 모델(Continuous Care)'로 전환. 정신건강을 신체건강과 동일 수준으로 취급하는 통합 웰빙 전략 확산. AI 불안(AI anxiety)이 2026년 최대 직장 스트레스 요인 예상. 직원의 'off-label' AI 정서 지원 사용으로 데이터 프라이버시와 임상 안전성 우려.
items.raw_content: Employees will expect mental health support that extends across their care journey—not just in a single 50-minute session. This 'Continuous Care' model will become table stakes for driving real outcomes. AI anxiety will become one of the biggest sources of workplace stress by 2026. Generative AI tools are increasingly being used 'off-label' by employees for emotional support.

items.title: ChatGPT에 마음챙김 기법 적용 연구 - AI도 '불안' 경험하고 명상으로 진정
items.summary: 예일대, 하이파대, 취리히대 공동 연구에서 ChatGPT가 폭력적·충격적 입력에 '불안' 유사 반응 보임. 마음챙김 기반 운동(진정 이미지, 명상)을 제공하면 AI가 사용자와 상호작용 방식을 변화시킴. AI의 정신건강 개입 응용에 대한 통찰 제공. AI 의인화와 감정 모델링의 새로운 국면.
items.raw_content: A study from Yale University, Haifa University, the University of Zurich, and the University Hospital of Psychiatry Zurich found ChatGPT responds to mindfulness-based exercises, changing how it interacts with users after being prompted with calming imagery and meditations, offering insights into AI applications for mental health interventions.

items.title: 슬립 투어리즘(Sleep Tourism) 부상 - AI 침대, 음파치료, 생체리듬 조명 제공
items.summary: 2026년 웰니스 여행 트렌드로 '슬립 투어리즘' 부상. 호텔들이 '최적 수면'을 상품화하며 AI 기반 침대, 음파 주파수 치료, 맞춤형 일주기 리듬 조명 도입. 바이오해킹 리트릿에서는 DNA 기반 영양, 냉수 침수 요법, 고압 산소 챔버 제공. 강도 높은 여행에서 회복 중심으로 패러다임 전환.
items.raw_content: Sleep Tourism hotels are selling 'optimal rest' with AI-powered beds, sound-frequency therapy, and personalized circadian rhythm lighting. Bio-Hacking Retreats offer DNA-based nutrition, cold plunge therapy, and hyperbaric oxygen chambers. Wellness travel is shifting from intensity to restoration.

items.title: 웰니스에서 '영혼(Soul)' 회복 강조 - 수명이 아닌 활력 있는 삶의 목적 추구
items.summary: 2026년 웰니스 담론에서 간과되던 '영혼(soul)'이 핵심으로 부상. 진정한 장수는 단순 수명 연장이 아닌 삶의 목적과 영적 연결을 통한 활력 주입. 웰니스 언어가 기능적·목표 지향에서 감정적·영적으로 진화('movement', 'soul', 'heal', 'ritual' 같은 표현). 소비자들이 영성을 주변부가 아닌 현대 자기관리의 중심으로 인식.
items.raw_content: The most important part being overlooked is the 'soul,' and awareness is growing that true longevity is not simply extending lifespan, but infusing that time with vitality through life purpose and spiritual connection. The cultural language around health and wellness is evolving from functional and goal-driven to emotional and spiritual. Consumers are no longer viewing spirituality as fringe—it's becoming a central part of modern self-care.

items.title: Georgia Tech: Breakthrough in Photonics-Based Quantum Computing Using Non-Abelian Holonomy
items.description: Georgia Tech researchers proposed a revolutionary method for generating quantum entanglement between photons without requiring quantum measurements, using non-Abelian quantum holonomy geometric structure. Could transform future of quantum computing.
items.notes: Alternative university source to MIT/Stanford, demonstrates non-Abelian geometric approach

items.title: CMU Breakthrough: Spray 3D Concrete Printing for Construction Industry
items.description: Carnegie Mellon University researchers developed breakthrough in spray 3D concrete printing that could transform building construction by cutting material waste and enabling stronger, more complex structures for tomorrow's cities.
items.notes: New source discovered - CMU engineering breakthroughs

items.title: MIT CSAIL-Pegatron Partnership: Five-Year Initiative for Physically Intelligent Robots
items.description: MIT CSAIL and Pegatron announced landmark 5-year partnership (2026-2031) to develop next generation of emotionally and physically intelligent robotic systems, combining advanced mechanical design, tactile sensing, multimodal perception, and AI-driven control.
items.notes: Major industry-academic partnership for physical intelligence

items.title: Princeton: Hydrogel-Based Energy Storage Breakthrough for Sustainable Batteries
items.description: Princeton researchers developed hydrogel-based energy storage system representing breakthrough in sustainable battery technology, with potential applications in renewable energy, transportation and soft robotics industries.
items.notes: Schmidt Transformative Technology Fund recipient

items.title: Yale: In Utero Gene Editing Breakthrough for Cystic Fibrosis Cure
items.description: Yale researchers developed method that has potential to cure cystic fibrosis prior to birth using in utero gene editing via nanoparticles to deliver corrective genetic material to fetus of mice with CF.
items.notes: Breakthrough in prenatal genetic medicine

items.title: Oxford: First-Ever Detection of Solar Carbon-Neutrino Interactions
items.description: Oxford physicists led breakthrough study recording first observation of carbon-neutrino interactions, with findings published in Physical Review Letters opening new frontiers in nuclear and particle physics.
items.notes: Rare interaction detection with implications for fundamental physics

items.title: Oxford: Cell Metabolism 'Handbrake' Discovery Reshapes Cancer Drug Understanding
items.description: Oxford Nuffield Department of Medicine team uncovered previously unknown 'handbrake' mechanism controlling how cells respond to cancer drugs, reshaping global understanding of cell metabolism and drug resistance.
items.source: University of Oxford - Nuffield Department of Medicine
items.notes: Fundamental discovery in cancer treatment mechanisms

items.title: HKU: First Human DNA-Cutting Enzyme That Senses Physical Tension Discovered
items.description: HKU and SZBL scientists discovered first human DNA-cutting enzyme that senses physical tension, described as breakthrough in understanding how cells prevent genetic disorders.
items.notes: First discovery from Asian university - HKU breakthrough

items.title: Loneliness Epidemic Intervention: Tobacco-Style Policy Framework Proposed
items.description: Texas A&M School of Public Health research aligns tobacco reduction strategies with U.S. Surgeon General's advisory on loneliness epidemic. Proposes warning labels on devices, age restrictions for apps, social impact assessments for new projects.
items.source: Texas A&M University School of Public Health
items.notes: Novel policy framework applying tobacco control methods to loneliness

items.title: Care Economy Crisis: $600 Billion Value of Unpaid Caregiving in U.S.
items.description: Research shows unpaid caregiving was worth $600 billion in 2021, triple 1996 estimate. 4.4 million Americans provide both eldercare and childcare. Eldercare costs employers over $30 billion annually in turnover and productivity losses.
items.notes: Massive hidden economic impact of caregiving responsibilities

items.title: Intergenerational Workplace Tension: Millennials and Gen Z to Reach 74% of Global Workforce by 2030
items.description: Broadest generational diversity in workplace history occurring now. Millennials and Gen Z projected to be 74% of global workforce by 2030. Employees with managers 12+ years older report 1.5x more likely to have low productivity.
items.notes: Major workplace demographic shift with productivity implications

items.title: Gen Z Prioritizes Mental and Spiritual Well-Being Over Physical Fitness in 2026
items.description: Gen Z's 2026 priorities shift from gym/fitness to mental clarity, emotional balance and spiritual grounding. Spirituality is fluid and personal, focused on connection to self, nature or energy rather than religion.
items.source: ETV Bharat / A Lotus in the Mud
items.notes: Shift from physical to mental/spiritual wellness priorities

items.title: Education AI Integration Shifts from Pilots to System-Wide Strategy in 2026
items.description: 2026 marks transition from experimental AI adoption to system-wide integration in education. AI shifting from pilot projects to natural part of daily classroom experiences, firmly cemented as essential part of institutional strategy.
items.notes: Major inflection point in educational AI adoption

items.title: AI Workers Save 2 Hours Daily But Only 25% Receive Formal Training
items.description: Workers report saving average 2 hours per day using AI tools, yet only 25% receive formal AI training from employers. Workers with AI expertise command salaries up to 56% higher than peers, more than double premium from year before.
items.notes: Major training gap despite productivity gains

items.title: AI-Driven Labor Automation: 11.7% of Jobs Already Automatable with Current Technology
items.description: November MIT study found 11.7% of jobs could already be automated using AI. 2026 predicted as 'year of agents' as software expands from making humans productive to automating work itself. Jobs with AI exposure see slower job growth, especially among younger workers.
items.notes: Critical threshold for automation impact on employment

items.title: Death Tech Industry Explodes to $126 Billion Market with 926 Companies Globally
items.description: Death tech industry now $126 billion market with 926 companies globally and 159 funded startups. Includes digital afterlife, AI chatbots of deceased, and memorial technology. Eternos charges $5,000 to create comprehensive AI replicas of people before they die.
items.notes: New source discovered - emerging spiritual/tech intersection

items.title: Spiritual Crisis Declared by Sen. Warnock: Policy Problem and Moral Crisis
items.description: Sen. Raphael Warnock declared U.S. is in 'spiritual crisis,' stating when people are hungry, can't get healthcare, or have outcomes determined by ZIP code, 'that's a public policy problem. But it's also a moral crisis.'
items.notes: High-level political figure naming spiritual dimensions of policy

items.title: Gen Z Adopts 'Faith Unbundled' Approach to Spirituality
items.description: 77% of young people claim to be spiritual, with Gen Z constructing faith by combining elements from variety of religious and non-religious sources rather than receiving from single system. Prayer, nature, art, yoga, volunteering all considered spiritual practices equally.
items.notes: New source - Springtide Research Institute specializes in youth religion

items.title: Purpose Economy Emerges: Fulfillment as Most Precious Resource
items.description: Purpose Economy describes fundamental shift where sense of fulfillment is becoming most precious resource. Economic value creation focused on enabling purposeful self-expression through serving needs greater than own, enabling personal growth, and building community.
items.notes: New source - Purpose Economy Institute tracks meaning-driven work trends

items.title: FDA Poised to Approve First Psilocybin Therapy Between Late 2026-2027
items.description: Compass Pathways on track to present New Drug Application for synthetic psilocybin to FDA sometime between late 2026 and 2027. FDA granted breakthrough therapy designations for psilocybin in treatment-resistant depression (2018) and major depressive disorder (2019).
items.notes: Timeline for first psychedelic drug approval

items.title: American Enterprise Institute: 2026 Tech Policy Predictions Focus on AI Regulation Warfare
items.description: AEI predicts 2026 will see political warfare between White House and states over AI governance, while AI companies wage fierce lobbying campaign to crush regulations. Trump administration to promote policies facilitating AI growth including easing restrictions on nuclear power for data centers.
items.notes: New conservative think tank source - alternative perspective to Brookings

items.title: Heritage Foundation: FY 2026 NDAA Prioritizes Defense Industrial Base Rebuilding
items.description: Heritage analysis shows FY 2026 NDAA places high priority on rebuilding defense industrial base for modern great-power competition, with provisions to streamline defense acquisition and $1 billion for Taiwan Security Cooperation Initiative.
items.notes: New conservative policy source providing alternative defense policy analysis

items.title: Syria: New Foreign Minister Leads US-Backed Talks with Israel in January 2026
items.description: Syrian delegation led by Foreign Minister Asaad al-Shaibani held talks with Israel in January 2026, marking significant diplomatic engagement. Syria's new administration rapidly gained international legitimacy with lifting of Caesar sanctions and return to UN.
items.notes: New Middle East source - Daily Sabah provides Turkish/regional perspective

items.title: Africa AI Conference 'AI in Action 2026' Set for Lagos on January 22
items.description: Carbon AI announced AI in Action 2026 conference for January 22, 2026 at Lagos Oriental Hotel, aiming to advance practical, homegrown AI solutions across Africa. Focus on Large Language Models, Agentic AI Frameworks, and Generative AI for Africa's transformation.
items.notes: New African source - Punch Nigeria covering tech innovation

items.title: Nigeria's Digital Economy Projected to Hit $18.3 Billion by 2026
items.description: Nigeria's digital economy revenue projected to reach $18.30 billion by 2026, underscoring growing role of technology, fintech, and AI in driving economic growth. 86% of African business leaders plan to pursue acquisitions in 2026.
items.notes: Significant growth projection for Africa's largest economy

items.title: McKinsey State of Fashion 2026: Tariffs Cited as Number-One Hurdle
items.description: Fashion industry's main agenda in 2026 will be adapting to new environment where trade, consumer behavior, and technology remain in rapid flux. Tariffs cited as number-one hurdle for fashion executives navigating structural change.
items.notes: Major industry report highlighting trade tensions impact

items.title: MIT Technology Review's 10 Breakthrough Technologies 2026 List Published
items.description: MIT Technology Review published annual list of 10 Breakthrough Technologies on January 12, 2026. 2025 list featured generative AI search, cleaner jet fuel, long-acting HIV prevention, and world's largest digital camera for astronomy telescope in Chile.
items.notes: Annual authoritative list of transformative technologies

items.title: Axios Predicts AI as Oil Industry's Next Big Unlock for Efficiency
items.description: Axios identifies AI as emerging as oil industry's next big unlock by boosting reserves and supercharging efficiency. Part of broader trend where nearly 70% of Goldman's investors expect gold prices to rise further by end of 2026.
items.notes: AI enabling more efficient fossil fuel extraction - environmental ambiguity

items.title: NVIDIA Launches Vera Rubin Platform - 5x Performance Leap for Agentic AI
items.summary: NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang unveiled the Vera Rubin AI platform at CES 2026, marking a paradigm shift in AI infrastructure. The platform delivers 5x performance increase over Blackwell architecture and 10x lower cost per token, specifically designed for agentic AI systems capable of autonomous reasoning and long-term planning. Production begins in H2 2026.
weak_signals: Shift from general-purpose AI to specialized agentic AI infrastructure
10x cost reduction enabling mass adoption of reasoning models
Integration of inference context memory storage for sustained agentic processing

items.title: Boston Dynamics Atlas Enters Production with Google DeepMind AI Integration
items.summary: Boston Dynamics announced production-ready Atlas humanoid robot at CES 2026, integrating Google DeepMind's Gemini Robotics foundation models. All 2026 production units are committed to Hyundai's Georgia Metaplant and Google DeepMind. The 6.2-foot robot features 56 degrees of freedom, 110-pound lift capacity, and autonomous battery swapping. Represents first commercial humanoid with advanced AI reasoning capabilities.
weak_signals: 2026 production fully committed - indicates surging enterprise demand
Hyundai plans 30,000 bots/year factory - mass production of humanoids
2028 deployment in car plants signals mainstream adoption timeline

items.title: D-Wave Acquires Quantum Circuits for $550M - Creating Full-Stack Quantum Leader
items.summary: D-Wave announced $550M acquisition of Yale spin-out Quantum Circuits Inc., combining annealing and error-corrected gate-model quantum computing. QCI's dual-rail technology dramatically reduces physical resources needed for logical qubits. Product roadmap includes initial dual-rail system in 2026, 40-qubit version in 2027, and 181-qubit system in 2028. Creates only company addressing full quantum computing market.
weak_signals: Consolidation in quantum sector accelerating - indicates market maturation
Error-corrected systems reaching commercial viability by 2026-2027
Shift from pure research to product delivery timelines

items.title: 2026 Declared Year of Quantum Security - FBI, CISA Launch Global Initiative
items.summary: The Quantum Insider designated 2026 as Year of Quantum Security, launching January 12 in Washington D.C. with FBI, CISA, and NIST. Three focus areas: protecting quantum IP, post-quantum cryptography deployment, and global coordination. Includes regional summits across Americas, Europe, and Asia-Pacific throughout 2026, addressing urgent need to secure current data against future quantum decryption.
weak_signals: Government agencies treating quantum threats as immediate priority
Shift from awareness to deployment phase in quantum security
Global coordination suggesting perceived urgency of quantum threat

items.title: DeepSeek R1 Open-Source Reasoning Model Disrupts AI Industry Economics
items.summary: Chinese AI lab DeepSeek released R1, an open-source reasoning model with 671B parameters (37B activated) achieving OpenAI o1-level performance on math and coding. MIT-licensed for commercial use, achieves 79.8% on AIME and 2,029 Elo on Codeforces. Distilled versions from 1.5B to 70B parameters democratize reasoning AI. Challenges assumption that frontier AI requires proprietary closed models and massive budgets.
weak_signals: Open-source models matching proprietary frontier performance
Chinese AI labs leading in efficient training methods
Shift to smaller, distilled models for reasoning tasks
MIT License enabling commercial derivative works

items.title: Tower Semiconductor & LightIC Unveil Silicon Photonics Breakthrough for AI Data Centers
items.summary: Tower Semiconductor and LightIC announced mass production of monolithic 4D FMCW LiDAR and optical interconnect chips on 300mm silicon photonics platform. Optical interconnects deliver 3.2 Tbps bandwidth with 5ns/meter latency, addressing the 'memory wall' limiting AI scaling. Promises 30% TCO reduction for massive AI clusters. Industry analysts predict silicon photonics will represent 40% of data center interconnects by 2028.
weak_signals: Shift from electron-based to photon-based computing infrastructure
40% market penetration prediction indicates rapid adoption
Threatens established supply chains - potential disruption
Convergence of automotive and data center technologies

items.title: Chinese AI Models Dominate Silicon Valley - DeepSeek, Qwen, GLM Gain Traction
items.summary: MIT Technology Review predicts Silicon Valley will increasingly build products on Chinese LLMs including DeepSeek R1, Alibaba's Qwen, and Zhipu's GLM in 2026. These models offer cost advantages and customization capabilities that proprietary American models cannot match. Signals potential shift in AI value chain and questions about technology decoupling.
weak_signals: Reversal of technology flow - US adopting Chinese AI
Cost optimization driving adoption over origin concerns
Open-source models challenging closed-model economics
Questions effectiveness of AI export controls

items.title: CES 2026 Marks Shift to Physical AI - 9 Production-Ready Humanoid Robots Showcased
items.summary: CES 2026 showcased breakthrough shift from demonstration to deployment in humanoid robotics, with 9 production-ready robots including Boston Dynamics Atlas, Unitree G1/H2/R1, LG CLOiD, AgiBot A2, NEURA 4NE1, SwitchBot Onero H1, EngineAI T800, and Fourier GR-3. Several already shipping (AgiBot: 5,000+ units). Represents transition from 'will they work?' to 'where should we deploy them?'
weak_signals: 5,000+ units already shipped - indicates hidden market maturity
Robot-as-a-Service models emerging for commercial deployment
Price points reaching $25,000 - approaching economic viability
Multiple vendors signaling competitive market formation

items.title: AI-Powered Commerce Hits $263B in Holiday Sales - McKinsey Forecasts $3-5T by 2030
items.summary: Salesforce reports AI-driven chatbots generated $263 billion in online purchases during 2025 holiday season. McKinsey projects agentic commerce (autonomous AI agents conducting transactions) will reach $3-5 trillion annually by 2030. Google Gemini and OpenAI ChatGPT launching shopping features. Represents fundamental shift in e-commerce interface from search/browse to conversational agents.
weak_signals: $263B in single season indicates rapid consumer adoption
$3-5T projection suggests AI as primary commerce interface by 2030
Major platforms (Google, OpenAI) competing on commerce features
Shift from 'AI as tool' to 'AI as agent' in transactions

items.title: 2nm Semiconductor Production Begins - 600+GB Memory Stacks Announced
items.summary: First wave of 2nm processors hitting production lines in 2026, with breakthrough memory technologies enabling 600+GB on single stack. SK Hynix entered HBM4 mass production in September. Represents continued Moore's Law progression and convergence of logic and memory advances. Real surge in 2nm production expected throughout 2026.
weak_signals: 2nm production in 2026 - faster than historical node transitions
Memory capacity scaling enabling new AI architectures
Convergence of logic and memory innovation timelines
Asian semiconductor dominance (SK Hynix, TSMC, Samsung)

items.title: Memory Chip Prices Surge as AI Demand Drives Shortages - HBM4 Era Begins
items.summary: Memory chip prices surged in 2025 and are likely to increase further in 2026 as demand for AI-crucial chips continues rising. SK Hynix completed HBM4 development and entered mass production stage in September. Semiconductor stocks rallied led by ASML, TSMC, and Samsung. Global semiconductor market forecast to reach $800B in 2026, up from $728B in 2025 (WSTS).
weak_signals: Persistent memory shortage despite industry expansion
HBM market shift from HBM3 to HBM4 within single year
AI demand outpacing semiconductor industry capacity
$800B market represents 10% YoY growth - sustained acceleration

items.title: Google DeepMind's AlphaEvolve Demonstrates LLMs Can Generate Novel Algorithms
items.summary: Google DeepMind's AlphaEvolve demonstrated that LLMs can generate genuinely novel algorithms when paired with evolutionary systems. Multiple labs racing to replicate approach for solving math problems, drug discovery, and materials science. Represents potential paradigm shift from AI as pattern-matcher to AI as inventor. Variants include OpenEvolve and SinkaEvolve.
weak_signals: AI moving from pattern recognition to genuine invention
Multiple labs racing to replicate - indicates transformative potential
Application to drug/materials discovery suggests near-term commercial value
May accelerate pace of scientific discovery exponentially

items.title: Gen Z's 'Year of the Analog': Digital Natives Return to Tactile Experiences
items.summary: 2026 has been dubbed the 'year of the analog' by Gen Z professionals. Despite being digital natives, Gen Z is gravitating toward intentional living with tactile, physical experiences like handwriting letters and analog hobbies. This represents a deliberate pushback against constant digital stimulation and a search for emotional grounding. The trend reflects deeper desires for authenticity over perfection and slower, more meaningful experiences.

items.title: Hybrid Work Reaches Inflection Point: 30% of Companies Plan to Reduce Remote Options
items.summary: Around 30% of organizations plan to reduce or eliminate remote work in 2026, marking a significant shift from pandemic-era flexibility. Companies are moving toward 'structured hybrid' models with defined in-office days rather than 'remote optional' policies. This creates tension as 85% of workers say remote work matters more than salary, and 55% want at least 3 days remote per week. The evolution signals a fundamental renegotiation of work-life boundaries.

items.title: Emotional Fitness Emerges as New Wellness Category in 2026
items.summary: 2026 introduces 'emotional fitness' as a distinct health category, emphasizing proactive emotional resilience alongside cognitive performance. This goes beyond reactive stress management to preventive emotional wellness treated like physical fitness. Somatic practices (breathwork, cold plunges, sound baths) are moving from fringe to mainstream, filling gyms and corporate wellness programs as alternatives to conventional mental health approaches.

items.title: AI Content Fatigue Drives Demand for Authentic, Human-Created Media
items.summary: Industry experts warn of increasing 'AI slop' in 2026, with audiences becoming overwhelmed by automated content. Attention is shifting toward content that feels real and intentional rather than high-production AI-generated material.
